tool_description: APIs for Ocean Freight Tracking and Emissions Monitoring
name: Sinay Dev
title: Sinay Dev

api_list.name: retrieveContainersStatusInBkOrBl
api_list.description:
This endpoint is used to retrieve the status of every container in a given booking or bill or lading on the given sealine.

For each container, it will return both the last event and the next event.

Example

If the last event is "Container Loaded" and the Next is "Container discharge", you'll know that your container is onboard a vessel.

optional_parameters.name: documentNumber
optional_parameters.description: (Required) A bill of lading number is a ten-digit number that's assigned by the carrier to identify the bill of lading. The booking number will usually consist of two letters and six digits.

optional_parameters.name: sealine
optional_parameters.description: (Required) Sealine code is a 4 digits alphanumeric character string, uniquely identifying the sealine.

optional_parameters.name: documentType
optional_parameters.description: (Required) Choose which type of document to use for retrieving data:  BL = Bill of Lading, BK = Booking

api_list.name: retrieveContainerEvents
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to retrieve all events of a given container, in the past of the future.

optional_parameters.name: number
optional_parameters.description: (Required) A Container Number is unique alpha-numeric combination of seven numbers and four letters used for identifying containers internationally.

api_list.name: retrieveYourMonthlyUsages
api_list.description: The endpoint allows you to retrieve your monthly usages of the API

optional_parameters.name: endTime
optional_parameters.description: End time at which usages must be found

optional_parameters.name: startTime
optional_parameters.description: Start time at which usages must be found

api_list.name: retrieveContainerStatus
api_list.description:
This endpoint is used to retrieve the status of a given container.

It will return both the last event and the next event of the container.

Example

If the last event is "Container Loaded" and the Next is "Container discharge", you'll know that your container is onboard a vessel.

optional_parameters.name: number
optional_parameters.description: (Required) A Container Number is unique alpha-numeric combination of seven numbers and four letters used for identifying containers internationally.

api_list.description: This endpoint is used to retrieve the locations of every container in a given booking or bill or lading on the given sealine.

optional_parameters.name: documentType
optional_parameters.description: (Required) Choose which type of document to use for retrieving data:  BL = Bill of Lading, BK = Booking

optional_parameters.name: sealine
optional_parameters.description: (Required) Sealine code is a 4 digits alphanumeric character string, uniquely identifying the sealine.

optional_parameters.name: documentNumber
optional_parameters.description: (Required) A bill of lading number is a ten-digit number that's assigned by the carrier to identify the bill of lading. The booking number will usually consist of two letters and six digits.

api_list.name: retrieveContainerLocation
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to retrieve the location of a given container.

optional_parameters.name: number
optional_parameters.description: (Required) A Container Number is unique alpha-numeric combination of seven numbers and four letters used for identifying containers internationally.

api_list.name: retrieveContainersEventsInBkOrBl
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to retrieve events of every container in a given booking or bill or lading on the given sealine.

optional_parameters.name: sealine
optional_parameters.description: (Required) Sealine code is a 4 digits alphanumeric character string, uniquely identifying the sealine.

optional_parameters.name: documentNumber
optional_parameters.description: (Required) A bill of lading number is a ten-digit number that's assigned by the carrier to identify the bill of lading. The booking number will usually consist of two letters and six digits.

optional_parameters.name: documentType
optional_parameters.description: (Required) Choose which type of document to use for retrieving data:  BL = Bill of Lading, BK = Booking

api_list.name: retrieveContainersEtaInBkOrBl
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to retrieve the ETA of every container in a given booking or bill or lading on the given sealine.

optional_parameters.name: sealine
optional_parameters.description: (Required) Sealine code is a 4 digits alphanumeric character string, uniquely identifying the sealine.

optional_parameters.name: documentNumber
optional_parameters.description: (Required) A bill of lading number is a ten-digit number that's assigned by the carrier to identify the bill of lading. The booking number will usually consist of two letters and six digits.

optional_parameters.name: documentType
optional_parameters.description: (Required) Choose which type of document to use for retrieving data:  BL = Bill of Lading, BK = Booking

api_list.name: retrieveContainerEta
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to retrieve the eta of a given container. It will return both the ETA at the next port of discharge and at the last port of discharge. If there are no expected transhipments, next and last will return the same value.

optional_parameters.name: number
optional_parameters.description: (Required) A Container Number is unique alpha-numeric combination of seven numbers and four letters used for identifying containers internationally.

api_list.name: getSupportedSealines
api_list.description: The endpoint allows you to retrieve supported sealines
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://sinay-dev.p.rapidapi.com/container-tracking/api/v1/sealines"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "sinay-dev.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://sinay-dev.p.rapidapi.com/container-tracking/api/v1/sealines"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "sinay-dev.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
